clinical_study.brief_title: Study of (Mirapex) Pramipexole for the Early Treatment of Parkinsons Disease (PD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group Clinical Trial to Examine the Efficacy and Safety of Early Pramipexole (PPX) Treatment Versus Delayed Pramipexole Treatment in Patients With New Onset Parkinson's Disease.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a double blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial of 15 months duration designed to examine early Mirapex (pramipexole) treatment vs. delayed Mirapex (pramipexole) treatment in patients with new onset Parkinsons disease

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Blinded Rater Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Total Score at Month 15
primary_outcome.description: The UPDRS total score (Parts I+II+III) measures the impact of PD on mentation, behaviour and mood, activities of daily living and motor skills on an ordinal scale ranging from 0 (no disability) to 176 (worst disability)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responders Using the Blinded Rater Assessment of Clinical Global Impressions of Global Improvement (CGI-I) Score at Month 15
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-I measures the overall improvement in the participants condition from baseline on an ordinal scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Responders are defined as those patients with a CGI-I of 1 or 2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Blinded Rater Assessment of Clinical Global Impressions of Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Category at Month 15
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-S measures the participants severity of illness on an ordinal scale ranging from 1 (normal) to 7 (extremely ill). At Month 15 participants were categorised to 'Improved' (>1 category improvement), 'Unchanged' or 'Worsened' (>1 category worsening).

secondary_outcome.description: The PDQ-39 measures aspects of health in PD participants, the overall index score is the mean of the eight individual domain scores measured on a continuous scale ranging from 0 (no problem at all) to 100 (maximum level of the problem)

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Minnesota Disorders Interview (MMIDI) Risk of Gambling at Month 1
secondary_outcome.description: The MMIDI is a semi-structured interview designed to assess impulse control disorders; risk of gambling is assessed via 12 questions, a participant is considered at risk if answering 'Yes' to Q1 and 'Yes' to 5 or more of Q2 to Q12.

secondary_outcome.description: The MMIDI is a semi-structured interview designed to assess impulse control disorders; compulsive buying is assessed via 4 questions, a participant is considered as being compulsive if answering 'Yes' to Q1a and 'Yes' to 1 or more of Q2a, Q3a and Q4a.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in the Striatum Uptake at Month 15
secondary_outcome.description: The striatum beta-carbomethoxy-iodophenyl-tropane (beta-CIT) uptake was calculated as mean of the left and right caudate and putamen regions; measured by the Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT).

Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Clinical Laboratory Measurements - Enzymes

Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Vital Signs

arm_group.description: Patients were treated with pramipexole for 6 to 9 months then up-titrated to target dose of pramipexole (2.25 mg/day).
Patients were treated with placebo for 6 to 9 months then up-titrated to target dose of pramipexole (2.25 mg/day).

facility.name: 248.595.39001 Azienda Ospedaliera Istituti Clinici di Perfezionamento
248.595.39010 Ospedale Maggiore Policlinico Mangigalli e Regina Elena
248.595.39012 Azienda Ospedaliera Pisana- Università degli Studi di Pisa
248.595.34001 Hospital Clinic i Provincial of Barcelona

group.title: Early Pramipexole
group.description: Patients initially randomized to pramipexole were up-titrated from 0.375 mg pramipexole daily to 0.75 mg pramipexole daily and then to 1.5 mg pramipexole daily over a 6 week period, and then 1.5 mg pramipexole daily was continued for the remainder of the 15 months of the study.

group.title: Delayed Pramipexole
group.description: Patients initially randomized to placebo, received placebo for 6-9 months, then up-titrated from 0.375 mg pramipexole daily to 1.5 mg pramipexole daily over a 6 week period. These patients were then continued on 1.5 mg pramipexole daily for the remainder of the 15 months of the study.

group.title: Early Pramipexole
group.description: 1.5 milligrams/day pramipexole (for up to 15 months)

group.title: Delayed Pramipexole
group.description: Placebo (for first 6 to 9 months) + 1.5 milligrams/day pramipexole (for following 6 months)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

group.title: Delayed Pramipexole
group.description: Placebo (for first 6 to 9 months) + 1.5 milligrams/day pramipexole (for following 6 months)

measure.title: Change From Baseline in the Investigator Rated UPDRS Parts II+III Score at Month 6
measure.description: The UPDRS Parts II+III total score measures the impact of PD on activities of daily living and motor skills on an ordinal scale ranging from 0 (no disability) to 160 (worst disability)
measure.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 1 patient from the FAS2 was excluded due to insufficient efficacy data.

outcome.title: Number of Responders Using the Blinded Rater Assessment of Clinical Global Impressions of Global Improvement (CGI-I) Score at Month 15
outcome.description: The CGI-I measures the overall improvement in the participants condition from baseline on an ordinal scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Responders are defined as those patients with a CGI-I of 1 or 2.
outcome.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 27 patients from the FAS2 were excluded due to insufficient CGI-I data.

group.title: Delayed Pramipexole
group.description: Placebo (for first 6 to 9 months) + 1.5 milligrams/day pramipexole (for following 6 months)

measure.title: Number of Responders Using the Blinded Rater Assessment of Clinical Global Impressions of Global Improvement (CGI-I) Score at Month 15
measure.description: The CGI-I measures the overall improvement in the participants condition from baseline on an ordinal scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Responders are defined as those patients with a CGI-I of 1 or 2.
measure.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 27 patients from the FAS2 were excluded due to insufficient CGI-I data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Blinded Rater Assessment of Clinical Global Impressions of Severity of Illness (CGI-S) Category at Month 15
outcome.description: The CGI-S measures the participants severity of illness on an ordinal scale ranging from 1 (normal) to 7 (extremely ill). At Month 15 participants were categorised to 'Improved' (>1 category improvement), 'Unchanged' or 'Worsened' (>1 category worsening).
outcome.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 4 patients from the FAS2 were excluded due to insufficient CGI-I data.

analysis.groups_desc: The ordinal responses (3 levels) were analysed using the proportional odds model extension of logistic regression

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Beck Depression Inventory-Version 1A (BDI-IA) Total Score at Month 15
outcome.description: The BDI measures symptoms of depression on an ordinal scale ranging from 0 (no symptoms) to 63 (worst symptoms)
outcome.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 3 patients from the FAS2 were excluded due to insufficient BDI data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire-39 (PDQ-39) Overall Index Score at Month 15
outcome.description: The PDQ-39 measures aspects of health in PD participants, the overall index score is the mean of the eight individual domain scores measured on a continuous scale ranging from 0 (no problem at all) to 100 (maximum level of the problem)
outcome.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial.

measure.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 3 patients from the FAS2 were excluded due to insufficient efficacy data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the European Quality of Life Scale (EUROQOL (EQ)-5D) Overall Index Score at Month 15
outcome.description: The EQ-5D measures health status on a continuous scale ranging from 0 (dead) to 1 (full health)
outcome.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 1 patient from the FAS2 was excluded due to insufficient efficacy data.

outcome.title: Modified Minnesota Disorders Interview (MMIDI) Risk of Gambling at Month 1
outcome.description: The MMIDI is a semi-structured interview designed to assess impulse control disorders; risk of gambling is assessed via 12 questions, a participant is considered at risk if answering 'Yes' to Q1 and 'Yes' to 5 or more of Q2 to Q12.
outcome.population: The FAS2 was made up of all treated participants with a baseline and on-treatment blinded rater assessment of the UPDRS during Phase 2 of the trial. 132 patients from the FAS2 were excluded due to insufficient MMIDI data.

outcome.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in the Striatum Uptake at Month 15
outcome.description: The striatum beta-carbomethoxy-iodophenyl-tropane (beta-CIT) uptake was calculated as mean of the left and right caudate and putamen regions; measured by the Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT).
outcome.population: The substudy set was made up of all randomised patients with a baseline and end of treatment assessment of striatal uptake.

group.title: Early Pramipexole
group.description: 1.5 milligrams/day pramipexole (for up to 15 months)

group.title: Delayed Pramipexole
group.description: Placebo (for first 6 to 9 months) + 1.5 milligrams/day pramipexole (for following 6 months)

measure.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in the Striatum Uptake at Month 15
measure.description: The striatum beta-carbomethoxy-iodophenyl-tropane (beta-CIT) uptake was calculated as mean of the left and right caudate and putamen regions; measured by the Single-Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT).
measure.population: The substudy set was made up of all randomised patients with a baseline and end of treatment assessment of striatal uptake.

outcome.title: Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Clinical Laboratory Measurements - Haematology and Electrolytes
outcome.population: Treated set: Haematocrit and mean corpuscular volume (MCV-N) was 211 for Early PPX and 209 for Delayed PPX, Haemoglobin-N was 213 for Early PPX and 212 for Delayed PPX, Sodium-N was 211 for Early PPX and 209 for Delayed PPX, Calcium and Chloride-N was 214 for Early PPX and 209 for Delayed PPX, Phosphate-N was 201 for Early and Delayed PPX

group.title: Early Pramipexole
group.description: Patients initially randomized to pramipexole were up-titrated from 0.375 mg pramipexole daily to 0.75 mg pramipexole daily and then to 1.5 mg pramipexole daily over a 6 week period, and then 1.5 mg pramipexole daily was continued for the remainder of the 15 months of the study.

group.title: Delayed Pramipexole
group.description: Patients initially randomized to placebo, received placebo for 6-9 months, then up-titrated from 0.375 mg pramipexole daily to 1.5 mg pramipexole daily over a 6 week period. These patients were then continued on 1.5 mg pramipexole daily for the remainder of the 15 months of the study.

measure.title: Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Clinical Laboratory Measurements - Haematology and Electrolytes
measure.population: Treated set: Haematocrit and mean corpuscular volume (MCV-N) was 211 for Early PPX and 209 for Delayed PPX, Haemoglobin-N was 213 for Early PPX and 212 for Delayed PPX, Sodium-N was 211 for Early PPX and 209 for Delayed PPX, Calcium and Chloride-N was 214 for Early PPX and 209 for Delayed PPX, Phosphate-N was 201 for Early and Delayed PPX

outcome.title: Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Clinical Laboratory Measurements - Enzymes
outcome.population: Gamma Glutamyltranspeptidase (GGT-N) was 214 for Early PPX and 208 for Delayed PPX, Amylase-N was 214 for Early PPX and 209 for Delayed PPX

group.title: Early Pramipexole
group.description: Patients initially randomized to pramipexole were up-titrated from 0.375 mg pramipexole daily to 0.75 mg pramipexole daily and then to 1.5 mg pramipexole daily over a 6 week period, and then 1.5 mg pramipexole daily was continued for the remainder of the 15 months of the study.

group.title: Delayed Pramipexole
group.description: Patients initially randomized to placebo, received placebo for 6-9 months, then up-titrated from 0.375 mg pramipexole daily to 1.5 mg pramipexole daily over a 6 week period. These patients were then continued on 1.5 mg pramipexole daily for the remainder of the 15 months of the study.
